node.text: Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is showing us her take on a classic gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from her Indian heritage. With curry leaves, mango, and lime juice, this tangy and super refreshing cocktail feels like summer in a glass. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Curry Leaf and Mango G&T

node.text: Al Thompson (@drunkenmixologist) shares his version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. With the combination of bright, citrusy grapefruit and floral lavender, this G&T becomes the perfect rooftop cocktail. Simple. Refreshing. Delicious. #StirCreativity

node.text: Watch as @eatwithchrissy makes a tangy, slightly spicy margarita using @cointreau_us, Scotch bonnet peppers, grapefruit, lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita uses Scotch Bonnet peppers to give a satisfying kick.

node.title: Margarita Season: Scotch Bonnet and Grapefruit Margarita

node.text: Watch as @andybaraghani makes a sweet and refreshing margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled pineapple and mint, and lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita is quite possibly *the* drink of summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Crushed Pineapple and Mint Margarita

node.text: Melissa Miranda (@meltronica) shares her version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from the Philippines with a riff on the Gin Pom. With grapefruit, ginger, cardamom bitters, a squeeze of lime, and @bombaysapphireus, this drink will remind you of being on the beach. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Ginger Grapefruit G&T

node.text: Julie Reiner (@mixtressnyc) is showing us how to make her spin on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. Julie grew up in Hawai'i and uses that for her inspiration, with watermelon, lemon, and coconut water for a bright burst of summer. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Watermelon Coconut G&T

node.text:
**Sound On** In honor of Mother’s Day, best-selling author and poet Kwame Alexander (@kwamealexander) asked 12 accomplished writers to reflect on how their lives—and their kitchens—mirror their mothers. Everyone got the same prompt, “I am becoming my mother,” and this community poem is a result. Head to the link in our bio to read more about the authors.
Contributors: @vanggarrett, Lesléa Newman, @engle.margarita, @marjorythw, Richard Michelson, Janet Wong, @georgiaheard1, @amstephens_, Maritza Rivera, Reuben Jackson, Lorna Goodison, @erikalsanchez, Deanna Nikaido, and Kwame Alexander

node.title: Kwame Alexander Reads The Ceremony of Giving

node.text: Watch as @empschultz makes a salty blueberry and ginger Margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled blueberry, ginger simple syrup, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita was inspired by a blueberry, ginger, and orange pie she made last summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Salty Blueberry & Ginger Margarita

node.text: DeVonn Francis (@tuna__turner) is showing us how to make his unique take on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. DeVonn uses pineapple as a nod to his Caribbean roots, celery to compliment the herbaceous notes in the gin, and bay leaf to tie all the ingredients in his Pineapple Celery G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Pineapple Celery G&T

node.text: Tiffanie Barriere (@thedrinkingcoach) shows us her own version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireUS. Tiffanie makes a strawberry and black peppercorn syrup for a sweet and spicy G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Black Pepper G+T

node.text: #Ad Esther Choi (@choibites), chef/owner of @mokbar_nyc, is showing us how to make a mandu stir-fry with lots of vegetables and of course, @bibigoUSA’s mandu.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 19, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: We would never turn down a chicken tender with a crisp panko coating, and this recipe by associate food editor Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) goes a couple steps further, incorporating sesame seeds and shredded coconut for added texture and flavor. The best part? Making them in an air fryer means you don't have to worry about a scary pot of bubbling oil, and clean up is a breeze. (Yeah, get ready to have a whole lot more chicken tender action in your life.) Click the link in our bio to make this over-the-top delicious recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @mpearljones

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 18, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and food.

node.text: Crispy-skinned salmon and fast-cooking bulgur get a special boost from a creamy mustard dressing in this recipe from cookbook author Abra Berens (@abraberens). We love just how quickly this whole grain-based dinner comes together. No waiting for brown rice to cook for 45 agonizing minutes—bulgur is “one of the original convenience foods,” says Berens. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @francesboswell

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 18, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: Best eaten right away, these Spicy Kimchi-Sweet Potato Fritters from contributor Diana Yen (@diana_yen_) are the perfect appetizer or indulgent snack. “The key to getting crispy burnished edges on these fritters is to wring out as much liquid as possible from the sweet potatoes before frying,” Yen said. The spice from the chopped kimchi in the fritter batter and the gochujang yogurt dipping sauce offset the natural sweetness of the sweet potatoes. It’s a dreamy marriage of crispy and creamy. This recipe is part of our meal planning package, where one recipe (Yen's Clean-Out-the-Fridge Kimchi) can become three quick weeknight meals. Click the link in our bio to make these crispy snacks. 📷: @isa.zapata 🍴: @mpearljones 🥣: Anne Eastman

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 17, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: Eating your veggies is never a struggle when they’re beer-battered and fried until crispy. This torta from L.A.’s @angryegretdinette is a riff on the fried squash blossom tacos that chef Wes Avila (@djwes) used to serve from his street cart. You can feel free to swap the zucchini for whatever vegetables are in season, but make sure to always keep the beer batter on ice and not to overcrowd the pan while frying. Click the link in our bio to make this delicious sandwich. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich 🥣: @sophiestrangio

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 17, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: A hearty handful of kimchi lends big flavor to this speedy stew. Satisfying, spicy, and comforting, this vegetarian dish from contributor Diana Yen (@diana_yen_) is inspired by the flavors of Korean kimchi jjigae. Lentils add heartiness and bite while the poached eggs add an irresistible ooziness. And while the flavors are complex, this dish couldn't be more simple to make. This recipe is part of our meal planning package, where one recipe (Yen's Clean-Out-the-Fridge Kimchi) can become three quick weeknight meals. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @isa.zapata 🍴: @mpearljones 🥣: Anne Eastman

node.text: On this episode of "It's Alive," @brad_leone is pickling avocados, with just a few ingredients and a little patience. Watch the full video on YouTube at the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 16, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: In Beijing, editor Karen Yuan’s (@_karenyuan) grandparents kept a giant jar in the back of the fridge. When she’d open the lid, the wild aroma of long-fermented zha cai would fill the room. Don’t let its humble appearance deceive you—a tiny bite of this preserved vegetable packs a powerful combo punch of tanginess and umami, and the texture is crunchy yet tender. All that flavor comes from salting, drying, and seasoning mustard stems with red chile paste, then packing them into vats with more aromatics like garlic, soy sauce, ginger, and sugar to ferment. It is truly a pickle to end all pickles. If you don’t want to make your own, Yuan recommends packets of ready-shredded zha cai from the Chongqing brand Yuquan, which you can find online and at Chinese grocers. Hit the link in our bio to read more on this fermented mustard stem that’s the perfect complement to noodles, congee, and more. 📷: @isa.zapata 🍴: @mpearljones

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 16, 2021. May be an image of sandwich.

node.text: Melty cheese and tangy, crunchy kimchi are a match made in heaven. This crispy, gooey, spicy, and utterly indulgent Inside-Out Kimchi Grilled Cheese recipe from contributor Diana Yen (@diana_yen_) requires just a few things: a strong, sharp cheddar to play off the tangy kimchi; the patience to let the cheese fully melt over moderate heat; and, most importantly, a fast and confident flip. This recipe is part of our meal planning package, where one recipe (Yen's Clean-Out-the-Fridge Kimchi) can become three quick weeknight meals. Click the link in our bio to make this dish ASAP. 📷: @isa.zapata, 🍴: @mpearljones 🥣: Anne Eastman

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 15, 2021. May be an illustration.

node.text: Chef Monti Carlo (@themonticarlo) was 12 years old when she was sent to live with her estranged father at a trailer park in Reno. There, spurred by dad's nightly tendency to recite inspirational quotes about Nostradamus, she decided to take one piece of advice to heart: "Visualize the life you want." The life she wanted? Matrimonial bliss with Wham! frontman George Michael. And how would she get there? By baking cookies, of course. Because you gotta have faith, faith, faith. (Sorry.) Find out how it all went down in Carlo's tender yet hilarious essay at the link in our bio. 🎨: @ouch_you_slouch

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 15, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: This easy Napa cabbage–based kimchi recipe makes use of any end-of-the-week crunchy veggie scraps you might have in the fridge—think bruised fennel bulbs, leftover cauliflower florets, and radishes that may have seen better days. In this Clean-Out-the-Fridge Kimchi recipe by contributor Diana Yen (@diana_yen_), everything gets coated in a spicy gochugaru paste before the kimchi is packed into jars and fermented at room temperature until it’s perfectly tangy. “Kimchi’s versatility comes from its ability to be eaten straight out of jars or used as an ingredient in cooking to give a flavorful kick to your meals,” Yen says. Once your homemade kimchi has reached a state of fizzy, funky perfection, Yen has three weeknight recipes you can use it in. (Kimchi grilled cheese, anyone?) Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @isa.zapata 🍴: @mpearljones 🥣: Anne Eastman

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on September 14, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: Inspired by the many meaty, brick-red stews of Mexico, this fall-apart pork shoulder from recipe developer Shilpa Uskokovic (@shilpauskokovic) cooks all day in the oven after an overnight marinade. Roasted low and slow with blistered orange halves, toasted coriander, garlic, and chiles, it emerges bronzed and tender, collapsing into thick shreds under the weight of a fork. And unless you’re feeding an army, this dish will yield plenty of leftovers—which are arguably the best part, and a good way to set yourself up for a week of quick meals. Use it to make sandwiches, stir-fries, tacos, fried rice, a diner-style breakfast hash, and more. Click the link in our bio to make this centerpiece-worthy pork roast. 📷: @isa.zapata 🍴: @mpearljones 🥣: Anne Eastman

node.text: Restaurants! We love them. We missed them. And we’re devoting our October issue to celebrating their resilience, their food, and the people who make them run. Who had the audacity to open in the middle of a pandemic? What restaurant dishes are worth traveling for? And who is making the industry’s future better and brighter than ever? Plus air fryer tricks, showstopping cakes, and design inspo from, yes, a brewery. Oh, you wanted recipes too? Your new fall favorites are in here too, thanks to @abraberens, @bayousaintcake, @laurelchs, @shergatt, djwes, giantlosers, chefgregcolliertn, wassaiclantern, slanteddoor, @sunnyblue_inc, @bacchanalwine, @bakingbandits, @hender.nyc, @ursula_brooklyn, @erictheawkwardscone, @chef_chriswilliams, and @coolhandmiz. Click the link in our bio to subscribe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich 🥣: @sophiestrangio
